txt.en: The farmers survived their capture at Thrymm's Farm. They appear to be relatively healthy, all things considered. After all they have been through, they should at least have their freedom.
The farmers of the Fallows were captured by the Lieutenant of Núrzum at Thrymm's Farm. If they still live, they are probably being held captive somewhere in Gárnoth's Farm.
You hear farmer's voices calling for help from nearby...

'Thank you, [placeholder], for everything you've done for us. We will find a way to make a living here inside the city.\n\n'My heart lives out on the land, on the plains... I was stubborn to give up that freedom before, when it was probably more wise to run to Forlaw. Trying to salvage that farm almost got us all killed. I would rather live, even if it's within these walls.'
The farmers survived their capture at Thrymm's Farm. They appear to be relatively healthy, all things considered. After all they have been through, they should at least have their freedom.
'Things didn't quite go as planned, but we appreciate your help through it all.'
The farmers survived their capture at Thrymm's Farm. They appear to be relatively healthy, all things considered. After all they have been through, they should at least have their freedom.
After being freed, the farmers have likely made their way back to the safety of Forlaw. You should head to the tavern since after surviving such an ordeal, some ale would look promising to anyone.
'Thank you, [placeholder]. We would not have made it without you.'
Speak with Cyneberg in Lornsettle
Gárwig is in Lornsettle, the mead hall of Forlaw. He will be happy to know the farmers have safely returned.
'I think you have saved me three times over by now, or have I lost count? Thank you, [placeholder]. We all owe you our lives.'

'Those good men did everything they could to maintain those farms, and tried to help Forlaw the only way they knew how. But, the enemy has made sure our farms remain smouldering, and those brave men were lucky to live through their ordeal. I will try to help them find work here inside the city.\n\n'Your efforts to help them were courageous, and they owe their lives to you. The people of Forlaw appreciate when we can see good men return alive, when so many do not.'

'Those good men did everything they could to maintain those farms, and tried to help Forlaw the only way they knew how. But, the enemy has made sure our farms remain smouldering, and those brave men were lucky to live through their ordeal. I will try to help them find work here inside the city.\n\n'Your efforts to help them were courageous, and they owe their lives to you. The people of Forlaw appreciate when we can see good men return alive, when so many do not.'
Free the farmers (0/4)
Free the captured farmers
The farmers have been through enough and should be freed from captivity. Their captor, Laudh, must be close by. Perhaps the farmers can sneak out unnoticed once freed.
Speak with Gárwig in Lornsettle
Free the farmers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Farmers freed ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Return to Forlaw and speak with the farmers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
They Deserve a Better Fate
Speak with Cyneberg in Lornsettle
